  • Method Details

    • addActor

      public boolean addActor(Actor a)
      Add an actor to the manager. Warning : it means that the actor can be deleted according to the sweeper method !
      Parameters:
      a - a valid Actor
      Returns:
      true if the actor is new, false of it isn't

    • getActorByID

      public Actor getActorByID(String id)
      Find and return the actor according to the ID provied, null if the actor is not present
      Parameters:
      id -
      Returns:
      an actor if it exists, null if not

    • deleteActor

      public boolean deleteActor(Actor a)
      Remove an actor accoriding to the instance itself
      Parameters:
      a - Actor instance

    • deleteActor

      public void deleteActor(String id)
      Remove an actor according to it's id
      Parameters:
      id - Actor ID

    • transfertToActor

      public void transfertToActor(String message, String actSource, String actDest)
      Transfert a message to an actor, usally a JSON
      Parameters:
      message - JSON format
      actSource - ID of source actor
      actDest - ID of destination actor

    • checkLifeTime

      @Scheduled(fixedRateString="${actor.lifetime.check.interval}") public void checkLifeTime()
      Update the lifeTime of each actors and delete thoses who has expired

      public long getCheckInterval()
      get the current Check Interval
      Returns:

    • getActorIdentifier

      public String getActorIdentifier()
      Get the actor Identifier. Maybe used to have the type of actor stocked and managed
      Returns:
      String in the begining of each actor ID, only if autoID is true

    • isAutoID

      public boolean isAutoID()
      Get the status of the actor manager : if false, you have to make the actors ID by yourself, if true The class will generate and check each actor ID
      Returns:
